trans-unit.source: Serves as the abstract base class for HTML server controls that map to HTML elements that are required to have an opening and a closing tag.
The most common controls with a closing tag are the `<form>`, `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<td>`, `<a>`, and `<span>` elements.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerText%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerHtml%2A> properties allow you to manipulate the content between the opening and closing tags of HtmlContainerControl-derived controls.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of HtmlContainerControl, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A new instance of this class is not created directly.

> [!CAUTION] > If you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerHtml%2A> property to specify the text between the opening and closing tags of an HTML server control, the text is not HTML encoded.
This makes it possible to embed script within HTML tags in the text.
When using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerHtml%2A> property, be sure to validate the value to reduce security vulnerabilities.
Otherwise, consider using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerText%2A> property instead.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> class using default values.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> class using default values.
> [!NOTE] > An instance of this class is not created directly.
This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The "span" literal string.|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> class using the specified tag name.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> class using the specified tag.
> [!NOTE] > An instance of this class is not created directly.
This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The value specified by the `tag` parameter.|
A string that specifies the tag name of the control.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object to hold the child controls (both literal and server) of the server control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> child server controls.
Gets or sets the content found between the opening and closing tags of the specified HTML server control.
The HTML content between opening and closing tags of an HTML server control.
Gets or sets the text between the opening and closing tags of the specified HTML server control.
The text between the opening and closing tags of an HTML server control.

Restores the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> control's view state from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.SaveViewState*> method.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The LoadViewState method calls the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A> method.
In addition, the LoadViewState method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.InnerHtml%2A> property.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the control state to be restored.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> control to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The Render method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Render%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to render the opening tag, child controls, and closing tag of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> control.
The Render method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> content.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> control's attributes to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> instance that receives the rendered content.
Renders the closing tag for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl"></xref> control to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The RenderEndTag method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.Render%2A> method to render the closing tag of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> control.
The RenderEndTag method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the rendered content.
